content.text:
Mr. McCONNELL. Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate 
proceed to the immediate consideration of H.R. 3243, which was received 
from the House.
content.speaker: Mr. McCONNELL

content.text: The PRESIDING OFFICER. The clerk will report the bill by title.
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER

content.text:
The senior assistant legislative clerk read as follows:

       A bill (H.R. 3243) to amend title 40, United States Code, 
     to eliminate the sunset of certain provisions relating to 
     information technology, to amend the National Defense 
     Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2015 to extend the sunset 
     relating to the Federal Data Center Consolidation Initiative, 
     and for other purposes.
content.speaker: The RECORDER

content.text: There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the bill.
content.speaker: The RECORDER

content.text:
Mr. McCONNELL. I ask unanimous consent that the bill be considered 
read a third time and passed and the motion to reconsider be considered 
made and laid upon the table.
content.speaker: Mr. McCONNELL

content.text:
The PRESIDING OFFICER. Without objection, it is so ordered.
  The bill (H.R. 3243) was ordered to a third reading, was read the 
third time, and passed.
content.speaker: The PRESIDING OFFICER
